intro: Silene tenella, commonly known as the slender campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pink to purple, with five petals and a distinctive, spurred lower petal. Silene tenella thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
